gurmukhi.Amrit Keertan: kwl purK kI AwigAw pwie pRgt BXo rUp muinvr ko ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: By the command of [A]kal Purakh [the Khalsa] took the form of the most exalted of sages, with matted hair from the top of its head to the smallest nail of its toe.

gurmukhi.Amrit Keertan: jtw jUt nK isK kr pwvn Bgq sUr dÍY rUp nrvr ko ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: By keeping company with the divine it achieved true purity, acquiring the noblest of forms which is that of the truly devoted (bhagat rup).

gurmukhi.Amrit Keertan: ckRvY pd dwq Dur pwXo Drm rwj BuMcq igrvr ko ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: Dharam-raj bestowed on it the rank of ruler supreme, setting its place far above all that others can reach.

gurmukhi.Amrit Keertan: audY Asq smuMdR pRXMqM Aibcl rwj imilE surpuir ko ]366]

W. H. McLeod.translation: From heaven he established its [paramount] rule, from the furthest shore to the uttermost limit. 366

gurmukhi.Amrit Keertan: pMQ ^wlsw BXo punIqw pRB AwigAw kr audq Bey ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: By his command the Lord created that Panth which is the Khalsa.

gurmukhi.Amrit Keertan: imtI dÍYq su jgq aupwiDn Asur mlyCn mUl gey ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: The earth was cleansed of refuse, both demons and malechhs.

gurmukhi.Amrit Keertan: Drm pMQ ^wls pRcur BXo sq sÍrUp mun rUp jey ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: The sacred and pure Panth multiplied, walking in the way of truth and piety.

gurmukhi.Amrit Keertan: kC kys ikRpwn qRY mudrw gur Bgqw rwmdws Bey ]367]

W. H. McLeod.translation: Kachh, kirpan, and kes — these three signs made followers of the Guru the servants [also] of God (ram das). 367
